answers.answer: No they won't consider changing your due date unless you didn't have any scans earlier on. The measurement is just a rough guide to the growth of the baby and it can be off by a week or two. So many things effect the measurement such as how the baby is lying, placenta size, amount of amniotic fluid and size of baby. The size of the baby can vary from a usual 6-10lbs which is a huge difference! Babies also have growth spurts. This is why they give you a due date from an early scan as it is much more accurate.
I have measured at least 2 weeks ahead since I was about 12 weeks and they have not changed my due date. They changed my due date once and that was at 7+2 four my dating scan.

In Uk they dont change ur due date if you are measuring ahead even if they find out from U/S... but if there are complications such as gestational diabetes or pre-eclampsia then they tend to induce early...

question: How many times do you have to measure farther along before they change your due date? Like at my 24wk appt I measured 26 weeks and I measured myself at home I'm now 26 wks and I.measure 29 wks. I go back for my 28 weeks appointment in like 2 weeks if I'm still.measuring 2 or 3 weeks bigger will they change it????
title: does anyone know?
